result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

There are no victims on this case.

9:12 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo.  Defendant Demario M Robinson not in court.  Attorney Thomas C Simon Atty in court for Demario M Robinson. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Atty Simon is unsure where his client is today and does not have a global offer as of today. 
Atty Simon requests a capias be stayed until the next hearing date as his client has never missed court. 
State requests warrant to issue and bail revoked and forfeited. 
Court will issue a capias and stay that capias until the next hearing date.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: 02:38 PM Defendant Demario M Robinson in court, in custody, with attorney Angela Wang.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Recess at 2:39.  Case recalled at 3:18 with same appearances.  Defendant requests the court appoint counsel. Defendant sworn. Court grants request, repayment at rate of $75.00 per month commencing 3/1/2022.   Defendant can appear by zoom for the next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Hearing on February 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 4 supervision.  Drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols.  Defendant to pay costs associated with drug testing.  Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.

02:10 PM Defendant Demario M Robinson in court, in custody, with attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Nimmer appears as friend of the court.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  The defendant is provided with a Petition for Court Appointed Counsel.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for February 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
